Module: ConfigApi

Chain Core can be configured as a new blockchain network, or as a node in an existing blockchain network.

More info: https://chain.com/docs/core/get-started/configure

Methods

<inner> configure(opts [, callback])

Configure specified Chain Core.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
opts Object options for configuring Chain Core.
Properties
Name Type Description
isGenerator Boolean Whether the local core will be a block generator for the blockchain; i.e., you are starting a new blockchain on the local core. `false` if you are connecting to a pre-existing blockchain.
generatorUrl String A URL for the block generator. Required if `isGenerator` is false.
generatorAccessToken String A network access token provided by administrators of the block generator. Required if `isGenerator` is false.
blockchainId String The unique ID of the generator's blockchain. Required if `isGenerator` is false.
callback objectCallback <optional>
 Optional callback. Use instead of Promise return value as desired.
Returns:
Promise resolved on success.
Type
Promise

<inner> info( [callback])

Get info on specified Chain Core.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
callback objectCallback <optional>
 Optional callback. Use instead of Promise return value as desired.
Returns:
Requested info of specified Chain Core.
Type
Promise.<CoreInfo>

<inner> reset(everything [, callback])

Reset specified Chain Core.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
everything Boolean If `true`, all objects including access tokens and MockHSM keys will be deleted. If `false`, then access tokens and MockHSM keys will be preserved.
callback objectCallback <optional>
 Optional callback. Use instead of Promise return value as desired.
Returns:
Promise resolved on success.
Type
Promise
